header.title: News
header.subtitle: There are {{ articles }} breaking-news headlines today.

rss.label: RSS (Really Simple Syndication)
rss.desc: The data in the article was sourced from the following RSS feed

not-found.title: Error
not-found.desc: An article with the ID {{ id }} could not be found.

article.rights: The copyright of the materials belongs to nyusu.com unless stated otherwise.
article.body: Nyusu.com is a small side-project of mine that aims to test your Japanese reading ability using headlines and excerpts from real Japanese news articles written by and for native Japanese people.

title: Most newspapers use only the 2136 characters in the jōyō kanji table.
The 5 major daily newspapers are the Yomiuri, Asahi, Mainichi, Sankei and Nihon Keizai Shimbun.
Today there are said to be 121 daily newspapers that are members of the NSK.

cards.body: Browse lots of headlines at a glance. Sort by difficulty and filter by source to find the best material for you.

newspaper.body: View a single headline in detail. Read related text from an excerpt from the article. See detailed information about the difficulty rating and export the contents into an Anki card.

anki-help.title: Integrating Nyusu with Anki
anki-help.1: Install the Anki desktop application, if you haven't already.
anki-help.3: Add nyusu.org to the CORS whitelist.
anki-help.whitelist-instructions: In Anki, go to Tools > Add-Ons > AnkiConnect > Config > webCorsOriginList > Add https://nyusu.org to the array
anki-help.about-settings: Anki integration can be configured in the settings drawer accessible in the websites header.

rating.description: An articles reading difficulty rating is calculated based on the number of the types of characters, their grades and the length of the text.

translate.description: Translate the article contents to confirm your understanding.

contents.label: Article Contents
contents.default: This article didn't provide any contents, but you can read it directly from the source below.
